bibl.title: An Egyptian Narrative from Karanis (P. Mich. inv. 5641a)
bibl.note: Karanis (Building 132), Second century AD. On the recto, Greek text of documentary nature. - See pp. 332-333: Archaeological Context. Points to other literary texts found in Building 132, in part. P. Mich. Inv. 5640 ined. (Greek mythological fragment about Phaethon) and 5771 ined. (fragments of Aesop's fables).
bibl.seg: Kim Ryholt, An Egyptian Narrative from Karanis (P. Mich. inv. 5641a).

Richard Jasnow & Ghislaine Widmer (edd.), Illuminating Osiris. Egyptological Studies in Honor of Mark Smith = Material and Visual Culture of Ancient Egypt. 2 (Atlanta, Georgia, 2017) pp. 277-301, figg.; - 394-395.

Karanis (Building 132), Second century AD. On the recto, Greek text of documentary nature. - See pp. 332-333: Archaeological Context. Points to other literary texts found in Building 132, in part. P. Mich. Inv. 5640 ined. (Greek mythological fragment about Phaethon) and 5771 ined. (fragments of Aesop's fables).
